div.p: STANLEY (Thomas), a very learned Engliſh writer in the 17th century, was the son of Sir Thomas Stanley of Cumberlow-Green in Herefordſhire, knight. He was born at Cumberlow about 1644, and educated in his father’s houſe, whence he removed to the university of Cambridge. He afterwards travelled ; and, upon his return to England, proſecuted his ſtudies in the Middle Temple. He married, when young, Dorothy, the eldeſt daughter of Sir James Engan of Flower, in Northamptonſhire. He wrote, 1. A volume of Poems. 2. Hiſtory of Philoſophy, and Lives of the Philosophers. 3. A Tranſlation of Eſchylus, with a Commentary ; and ſeveral other works. He died in 1678.
